WRITING.TEXT: Oh I get horrible show nerves - I actually have to take a beta blocker to be able to ride competently. And I do the Hunters/Eq. My local organization has a .70 m jumper division this year that I REALLY want to do, but I don't know if my trainer will allow it! Lately I've been jumping 2"6 at home but I might just do 2"3 next weekend. My only reservation about 2"3 is that it's filled with kids who are literally like 10 years younger than me haha
I'll definitely be adding Powerade Zero or something similar to my grocery list next week as I am already experiencing some symptoms of electrolyte deficiency/imbalance.
Yeah I'm back in regular therapy so hopefully that helps. I see my therapist today and will definitely be explaining this to her.
Thank you for the suggestions! Haha I'll try to kick ass. I'm still debating whether or not I want to do it. I'm kinda also stressing about which divisions to pick!

Yeah I totally get you. I think I might make my macros 20c/40f/40p just because the added fat really does help me feel full. But I'm not mentally equipped to be adding fat for the sake of adding fat, if that makes sense.

WRITING.TITLE: I feel sick to my stomach.
WRITING.TEXT:
And, I mean this mentally, not physically.
I hate this eating disorder so much. I woke up this morning completely emotionally labile. All I think about is food. My day revolves around when I'll be eating, when I won't be eating, *what* I'll be eating. I planned to eat some eggs with 2 strip of bacon for breakfast (264 calories). I plan out my food a week in advance, so I knew this was coming. I had a similar breakfast yesterday? Two days ago? I don't remember. I sat down to eat it, picked at it, got up and threw it away. Maybe it was the fat that was bothering me?
So I went to the freezer, grabbed some fruit I had portioned out, thawed it, took a shower and came back to the fruit. I pierced a piece with my fork and couldn't do it. Maybe it was the carbs/sugar? I don't know, but I threw the fruit away, too. THEN I decided to make an egg white omelet with no bacon, no butter, no oil. Just straight up protein. And yes, I threw that out as well.
Nothing is safe to eat. There's nothing I want to eat. I know I need to fuel myself, particularly as an athlete, and additionally with final exams coming up. But I can't do it. I can't even get myself to compete in a horse show because it means I need to fuel myself. I hate this. My eating disorder is winning. I'm starting to pick my eating disorder over the love of my life (my horse). Eating disorders are about control, but I never thought I'd allow it to control my horse riding. I thought I had control over what my eating disorder controls...I guess I don't. I just want to lay in bed and cry all day. In theory, I have a really lovely life, but I'm wasting it on this eating disorder.
Yeah...I woke up this morning deciding I don't think I'll do it for much longer. I'm eating 500 calories a day or less, but my weight has stalled and I don't "feel thin" with keto.
Ah! Thank you so much!

Yep! I was thinking a big scramble of bacon and eggs would be perfect for horse show days. Thank you! I'll think about the cheese thing. I love love love cheese but am sadly lactose intolerant so I can only handle a small amount.
Thank you so much for the suggestion!

You lose based on whatever your deficit is. The larger the deficit, the faster the weight loss/greater loss per week.
For example, my TDEE is around 1800. If I were to eat 1000 calories a day, that's an 800 calorie deficit per day. There are 3500 calories in a pound. So if I eat at an 800 calorie deficit per day for 7 days, that's 800*7 = 5600 calorie per week deficit. 5600/3500 = 1.6 pound loss per week.
Say I eat 500 calories a day. That's a 1300 calorie per day deficit. So 1300*7 = 9100 calorie per week deficit. 9100/3500 = 2.6 pound loss per week.
Of course there are major fluctuations with water retention, the loss of water weight, etc, meaning weight loss is not linear. Sometimes you will lose more or less weight than mathematically laid out. For me, eating 0-500 calories a day, I lose around 4 pounds per week.

eating something starchy the night before a REALLY big workout
You know, in the past with showing, I typically wouldn't eat all day prior to my time to compete. However, I felt totally okay competing on an empty stomach/competing with no food in my system that day because I was eating a hearty dinner the night before, like a burrito or a chicken kabob plate with rice and hummus + pita. So eating dinner is something I could consider doing. Or, saving my 500 calories for 1 meal the day of the show, and having that like an hour before I compete.
a few pieces of candy with me in my pockets (like Hershey's kisses or mini Reese's cups) so if I feel like I'm going to pass out I can quickly spike my blood sugar.
I kinda do this now. Well, I had been doing this prior to starting keto. I'd be coming off from a 36 hour fast, getting ready for a horse riding lesson. So I'd have a 100 cal granola bar to spike my blood sugar so I don't die during my lesson lmao
Thank you so much for all the advice and tips! I'll definitely take these things into consideration. I'm still not 100% certain if I want to show because ED thoughts are still lingering in my head. My therapist will want to talk me into doing the show, but at the same time, she'll try to talk me out of it if I'm not committed to nourishing myself.
3

Thank you for this advice! I was actually thinking, since my limit is 500 calories a day, I could eat that in one meal right before I ride. If I show, I'll be showing in the morning on Friday then the late morning on Saturday. So I guess reverse intermittent fasting in a way!

No, it's muscle that gives you more calories. However, if someone is overall obese/overweight, then yes, they have more calories because there is more of them. That's why some obese people can lose weight eating 2000 calories a day, whereas an average person would need ~1200-1400 calories.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm freaking out!
WRITING.TEXT:
Okay I feel like a loser for posting twice within like, an hour, but something came up and I am genuinely freaking out...
I don't know if any of you remember, but my horse show in April got canceled due to the weather. It's been rescheduled for next weekend and I assumed my barn wasn't going to attend because there were other shows coming up and our main trainer is going out of the country this weekend for like 10 days.
Well, I just got a group barn email and we **will** be doing the show next weekend. On one hand, I'm happy because I haven't shown my horse since November and I love showing. On the other hand, it means I need to fuel myself properly to compete :( and mentally I just can't do that. I can't. I can't I can't I can't.
Sorry I'm being a negative Nancy here. I just can't believe a) I'm so stressed about *this*. *This* being something I absolutely love aka my #1 passion. And b) I can't believe my eating disorder has gotten *so bad* that I'm considering not doing what I love most, simply because of food.
Fuck eating disorders, honestly. I have no idea what I'm going to do. I see my therapist tomorrow and I'll talk to her about it, but until then, I'm going to be a big fat ball of stress.
I hate this.

I typically empty my bladder and bowels as soon as I wake up in the morning. My cut off time for eating is 6:30pm - but not for weight reasons. I do this simply because I like going to sleep with my stomach concave.

Keto day 4!
Breakfast: 2 egg whites (34) + 7g butter (50) + 2 slices bacon (60)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner: 2.5 oz chicken (75) + 11g butter (79)
Exercise: Horse riding (154)
Total: 298-154 = **144 net calories**

WRITING.TITLE: I saw my psychiatrist today.
WRITING.TEXT:
Before I start, let me just thank all of you who put up with my drunk posting/commenting last night. I can't even comprehend half of what I wrote. Something about Drake and Rihanna at one point? I love you guys!
Anyways, I saw her about a month ago for a short 20 minute session to get a refill on my beta blocker. During that session, I told her I was fine, that everything was fine, blah blah blah and I was on my way. But I started seeing my ED therapist again and she suggested I see my psychiatrist in addition. So I emailed my psychiatrist, told her I was not honest with her during our last session and am going through an ED relapse.
My session was good. I feel like she really understands me. She put me back on Prozac to help with the depression aspect of the relapse. If I don't "get better" ED-wise in the next month (our next session is June 1), then she is going to have me get blood work and an EKG done. She said she *really* wanted to write the order today, but she realized it would be too overwhelming for me. I'm **so** happy she understands *that* much and isn't being pushy. She realizes it takes a lot for someone to admit they have a problem and doesn't want to overcorrect too much because it might make things worse.
I also decided I'm going to *try* to start restricting to 500 calories a day with some fasting days here and there. Part of me is recovery minded and a huge part of me is still very much eating disordered. 500 calories is the max I can eat without feeling like shit. While it's still relatively low, it'll probably help me with the idea of reaching a caloric goal or whatever if I ever decide to fully recover. So even if I want to eat 300, I'm still going to aim for 500. Maybe I'll even have more energy to exercise!
I hope you all have had a wonderful day!

This is me. This is so me. Yes, I am half a foot shorter than you but I'm literally exactly the same. My top half looks so fucking thin, but then from the hips down I feel like an elephant. I have a *cute* but, not fat, because horse riding and lifting. But my thighs oh my god. There is a picture of me next to the definition of "thunder thighs" in Urban Dictionary. Probably.
We are almost stats twins and babe I totally feel ya. I was 134ish at the end of March and now I'm 112ish. Aside from being "ribbier" and "hip bonier", I think I look exactly the same :(

when it comes to calculating maintenance calories, is it important
For me, a 10% decrease in body fat actually gives me an extra 200 calories a day for maintenance.

Haha I still rode. I woke up horribly hungover (ended up having an addition ~300 calories worth of alcohol, fuck). Usually physical activity cures me of my hangover so I bit the bullet and went to the barn.

No I don't take any supplements. I heard that supplements/multivitamins are useless because they're meant to complement the food you're eating, but if you're not eating close to enough food, it's useless. This is what I've heard! I don't know how accurate it is.

fruit is actually so shit, it's just sugar and water
Yes! Fruit is glorified dessert! But with nutrients and stuff haha.

You feel full but not uncomfortably full. Full is honestly the wrong word when it comes to keto. You feel *satisfied* more than anything for hours. My stomach/ribs/whatever is still totally concave after I eat anything keto.
She cancelled! She said she was "sick all night" lmao I think we was drinking last night, realized she has to teach me in the morning, and woke up hungover.

Hummus IS love. On my Tinder bio (yes, I have Tinder. I am too lazy to find hookups at clubs/bars) it says "I like hummus and wine". That's it.
We are always here for you 3

Hummus is sooo good and honestly really healthy. I hope you are able to hope with your anxiety and stress. I find that the busier I am, the less stressful food/restricting is! Let me know if you need any support 3

Well, the tequila I'm drinking is Costco/Kirkland brand tequila. It is a HUGE 1.75 litre bottle and it cost me like $17!!!! Great price for great quality and quantity tequila. As a single person I only go to Costco twice a year, but the alcohol prices alone are worth it. At a normal store, a bottle of Moet Chandon (aka my fave champagne) costs $60 but at Costco it's $35!

Ah! Well you know, tomorrow is a new day. Don't try to overcorrect TOO much tomorrow. Give yourself a more than reasonable calorie goal tomorrow and you'll be on your way to success!!! 3 Personally, trying to fast the day post-binge/overeating is absolutely painful, so I give myself a higher calorie goal (i.e. 800-1000) which really helps!

How about scotch? When my mom was here, she had me buy her a bottle of scotch. There's ~1/4 bottle left. Not that I would drink it tonight, but I was always under the impression that darker liquors had more sugar?
And yas I'm so happy about not having a Dorito mini-binge! Awkward, but my trainer texted me just now saying "we good for 10am tomorrow" aka 12 hours before my lesson. I said yes! Hopefully I am not hungover in the morning lmao
BABE don't even worry about it. I used to have pita with hummus every night after horse riding and I still lost weight.
I have had approx 6 oz tequila with a bottle of Sparkling Ice Water! Tastes like a snazzy cocktail with few-ish calories.
SAME. 8:30pm and I was like "I'm bored af and hungry, what do I do." The answer? DRINK.
You are more awesome I love you 3

My psych better appreciate! And honestly, being drunk makes me eat more. I was JUST about to eat some Doritos (240 calories), but then I remembered it would take me out of ketosis. If I had a keto-friendly snack, I totally would have eaten it.

You know I'm actually totally willing to sell my soul to the devil to trade anorexia for drunkorexia. At least alcohol gives me *some sort* of emotional and physical feeling. Gahhh why did I ever give up alcohol. 800 calories of food + alcohol is so much better than food alone.

You know, I see my psychiatrist tomorrow. I ended up drinking more, so my calorie count is 695 right now. I will tell her I ate over 500 calories for the first time in 17 days and, though it's mostly from alcohol, she better be proud. A calorie is a calorie (insert sunglasses emoji).

Omgggg I was literally about to eat a bag of Doritos and I somehow was able to remind myself if I had Doritos it would bring me out of ketosis. I'm so glad tequila (and apparently vodka right?) is 0 carb.

Ahhh I have never had Rumchata bc sugar/carbs :o but I want to try. I think I'm going to stop keto on Monday so I can enjoy alcohol again.
My fave song right now is probably one dance by Drake oh my god will he and Rihanna please get married already? And my fav fav fav drink is diet coke with Amaretto but I can't drink it on keto because carbs :( if not Amaretto + diet coke then definitely champagne.
Update: I feel really fat and gross for having 557 calories today. Oh my god fucking eating disorders in the ass honestly.

I'm drunk, too! My first time drinking in almost 3 weeks + keto makes it very easy to get drunk!
I don't know what cocktail you had but have you tried Sparkling Ice Water + clear liquor? Right now I'm drinking an entire bottle of Sparkling Ice Water with a few shots of tequila, totaling to 270 somethingishh? Basically you get as much of the liquor as you want and the mixer is 0 cal.
Yes. I feel that always. I have had 557 calories today when I only planned 300. Obviously 557 is still a *huge* deficit, but I feel horribly guilty. Stupid ED. Hang in there babe 3

WRITING.TITLE: Fuck it, I'm drinking.
WRITING.TEXT:
I haven't had any alcohol in 17 days. I fucking miss it so much. I'm doing keto and I discovered that tequila has 0 carbs. Sparkling Ice Water is just water + Sucralose (maybe? water with stuff ok, it's 0 cal), essentially, so combine the two and it's a *relatively* low cal cocktail. It's fucking delicious. Unfortunately, that means I've had over 250 calories extra today, bringing my grand total to 557. So basically an entire bottle of Sparkling Ice Water + 3.5-4 shots of tequila (lmao I used my Blender Bottle to measure). But the extra calories are coming from alcohol, so I don't feel as bad. Does anyone else feel less guilty about extra alcohol calories vs extra food calories? Sorry for my f-bomb dropping. I just really love alcohol, ok.
3
Is it Gold Standard? I have their vanilla ice cream and delicious strawberry flavors - sooo good.

Haha it seriously would be. 1 scoop of protein powder + a glass of almond milk is 150 calories. So it would be 450 calories a day = ~75g protein! I honestly might do that once a week because I lose around a pound from protein shake "fasting" for 24 hours.
Good luck! I hope you like it! I try to remind myself that not being bloated + feeling full (but not fat-like full) + still having a flat tummy after eating is worth it!

I've never lost my period even at my lowest BMI of ~16. BUT when my anorexia first developed when I was 14, I recall a time where I got my period, then got a full blown period 2 weeks later. So I'd imagine menstrual irregularities don't only occur with extremely low body fat, but a mix of nutrient deficiencies as well.

I *think* I can hit 75g if I make protein a priority, even while eating 300-500 calories a day. We shall see! I am going to see how the rest of this week of keto goes and reevaluate come Sunday. Thank you so much for all your input! 3

I suppose I've just been brainwashed by the people of /r/keto! I try to stick to 20g or less of carbs, so I suppose I could get away with splitting my fat and protein evenly. I've noticed I'm bruising really easily, getting muscle spasms and overall I've been in some pain on and off, so I guess it's definitely a sign I need to up my protein.

1000 calories a day is definitely still going to be a deficit for you, so you won't gain. If you do gain, it'll be temporary water weight since it's, as you said, more food than your body is used to. But within a few days your weight will even out 3

I've been thinking about upping my protein, particularly because I find it so hard to stay within the 300-500 range with 65% fat. But I have heard that keto doesn't "work" with more protein. So I'm not sure. As an athlete, I honestly should be eating 40% protein in my diet but with keto that's not going to work. So...as you can see, I'm in quite a bit of a conundrum. Honestly I'm thinking about just saying "fuck it" and living off of protein shakes for the rest of my life! Kidding (kind of)!!!
On the bright side, you won't feel hungry compared to when you eat carbs!

it's like no matter what we do there's always the irrational part of our brain that convinces us we're messing up regardless of what logic tells us.
You're so damn right. Honestly, I can't tolerate carbs, I can't tolerate fat either, so what's left? A 100% protein diet? Sometimes I feel like I'd honestly rather not eat at all.

I eat anywhere between 300 and 500 calories a day and I'm rarely hungry. My macros are 5c/30p/65f. I'm reaching the goals pretty well. I'm usually 3% under on fat and 5% over on protein, but I'm working on figuring out how to meet the macro goals spot on. The only carbs I consume come from vegetables, and some days I have absolutely 0g carbs.
Are you used to it now? How long did it take for you to accept that keto is better for you than carbs?
Ah! I'm 22 and I remember having 1 or 2 pairs of boot cut and flare jeans from Abercrombie from middle school. I'll have to see if I can find them!
Oh wow! I had no idea they made eye cream with caffeine in it. Now that you mention it, I do have a really nice eye cream already. I should probably start using it.

So basically you take any quantity of chicken breast/cutlets (for me it's anywhere between 2 oz and 3.5 oz). I soaked it in 1/4 cup lemon juice for 30 min in the fridge. After 30 min, I season the chicken with a mixture of salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder and dried parsley. I melt anywhere between half a tablespoon and a full tablespoon of butter in a pan. Once it's melted I add the remaining lemon juice and just cook the chicken in it! Oh, I allow the lemon/butter mixture to thicken a bit before adding the chicken. But not too thick or it'll like, evaporate haha. Yesterday I also added arugula (cooked in the lemon/butter concoction) but I forgot how bitter arugula is on its own, so it was almost inedible with the lemon. I'm thinking of switching to spinach instead of arugula next time.

WRITING.TITLE: Day 3 of Keto and I still can't shake the false notion of "fat makes you fat".
WRITING.TEXT:
Logically I know that fat doesn't make you fat. I know that, in reality, excess calories is what makes you fat. Don't get me wrong, I love keto. I feel fuller despite eating more calorie dense foods and I don't feel bloated after eating. My stomach still looks concave even if I've had a 250 calorie fatty meal!
But then my ED brain/body dysmorphia makes me look in the mirror after my keto meal and all I see is...fat. Fat everywhere. Fat thighs, fat lower belly, fat arms. I don't know how to shake this feeling. I don't know what to do. Yet I don't want to go back to carbs, because bloating/water weight/etc. But eating fat makes me feel fat.

Eeeek! But now all my clothes are getting too big on me. I have *some* clothes from when my ED first developed that will definitely fit me, but they are 8 years old and definitely *not* in style anymore.
Good to know!
Thanks so much!
I don't really drink broth but how do you like better than bouillon? My friend cooks with it a lot. When you make it a broth, do you just add hot water and stir?

300-500 a day is my comfort zone. Below 300 and I feel like I'm fucking psychotic because that's so few calories. Anything above 500 I really do feel like a fat ass. I remember I used to eat around 800 a day and I would lose so much weight. I was also a *bit* more active then but as of now, I'm not willing to add physical activity in exchange for more calories.

So today I looked up how much exactly and I was stunned. Every day, a volume of water equivalent to twice your entire blood volume is secreted into the interior of your gut! It can be as much as fifteen pounds of water a day!
OH MY GOD I'M SCREAM. I can't believe this! It makes me feel a little better but I still can't believe!!! I kind of also have been questioning the whole sodium thing. I remember once I was restricting to 400 calories and I had 1 cup of soup. The amount of sodium I consumed for the whole day, according to MFP, was ~60% less than the recommended, but I was still up 0.4 pounds in the morning! Everyone said "oh it's sodium, soup has a lot of sodium", while that's true, I really didn't consume that much sodium the entire day.
12-48 hours later when the food finally reaches the large intestine.
I also had no idea that it takes *that* long for food to reach the large intestine. That also makes me feel a bit better!
Babe you are seriously such a rockstar! Thank you SO much for this, always being there for me and always going into detail 3
Oh cool! I'm not looking to spend a ton of money (right now at least) so I'll try Hard Candy. If that doesn't help I'll save up for IT.

Restricting and fasting really fucks up my sleep. It takes a little longer to fall asleep and even if I get my usual 7-9 hours of sleep, it's so hard to get out of bed in the morning. I now have bags under my eyes. Is there any way to fix/cover them up? I've tried putting a little extra foundation/eyeshadow that matches my complexion under my eyes but it doesn't seem to help.

I used to. In the past when I'd restrict, I would have absolutely no problem eating normally if a social setting called for it. Like, if my friends invited me out to lunch, I would have a totally normal lunch with them and even some dessert. I wouldn't necessarily reach maintenance calories so I never gained *much* weight outside of water weight from the carbs and sodium in the meal. I would happily go back to restricting the following day and restrict until another social event came up. I was much happier back then, infinitely more social and I still lost weight. However, I am currently at point where I avoid *all* social settings. I do this despite knowing I'm not *actually* going to gain weight, and I have the ability to go back to restricting the following day with no harm done.
Aw yiss

It's so hard do focus on the big picture when the day to day is annoying
It so is. It makes me feel like I'm going to be stuck at my current weight forever! I try to remind myself that I thought the same thing when I was 10 pounds heavier, but now look where I am! But it's still frustrating because I'm *so close* to my lowest adult weight but these fluctuations and plateaus are killing me!

Drinking more water will flush out some of that salt
You're sooo right. I'm going to force myself to drink more water today. Thank you!

Yeah I think I'm definitely dehydrated! Also the combination of doing keto is dehydrating me. I'll try to up my water intake. My only fear is that I won't pee out enough water for my morning weigh in, and be heavier/at a plateau. But...for my own sanity I should try not to weigh in *every* morning.
Lol! Seriously!

Keto day 3!
Breakfast: 2 egg whites (34) + 2 slices bacon (60) + 6g butter (43)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner (planned): 4 egg whites (69) + 13g butter (93)
Exercise (planned): 30 min HIIT (~300)
Total: 299-300 = **-1 net calories**

I had one 17 oz bottle of regular water, a bottle of Sparkling Ice water (which I guess is 17 oz as well?) and 2-3 cups of coffee. Maybe 4 cups. I don't remember. But I feel like I peed *a lot* yesterday so I'm kind of surprised that I might be holding on to water/liquid weight. But I guess it's definitely possible.
That kind of puts my mind at ease a bit. Thank you!

it read 32 (funny, I don't look dead.)
LMAO! I laughed out loud!

I do take measurements almost every day and they seem to be staying the same. However, my arms do look smaller and my shorts have gotten way too loose on me - seriously with even step I take I feel like they're about to fall off! I mean clearly I *am* losing weight but I don't *feel* like I'm actually losing weight unless the scale tells me so.
I usually don't like logging my weight in happy scale unless I weigh less than my previous weigh in, but I think I'll start logging. Maybe the trend will make me feel a little better.
Thank you so much! You're so supportive and awesome as always 3
I like to eat little things throughout the day so a) I'm never hungry b) I'm also never full and c) because it scares the hell out of me to think about eating 500 calories in one sitting.

I'm short and desire to be tiny. I'm also bisexual and I prefer my women tall and skinny so...I guess I'm attracted to what I *wish* I were? I really do hate being short. I feel like I'll always be cute and never sexy.

WRITING.TITLE: That's it. I'm done weighing myself every day.
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm somehow up 0.2 pounds since yesterday despite having 400 calories and 0 carbs. I bought a second scale and it's reading me almost 3 pounds higher than my other scale. It's all just such a mind fuck. Also, TMI ALERT I am constipated so that's preventing me from knowing my true weight. I'm going to drink coffee to see if it'll give me a BM but even one cup of coffee always makes the scale read me at last 0.6 pounds higher. I can't trust the scales anymore.
I guess I'll try to weigh myself once a week and see how that goes. I wish I had never broken my good scale. Fuck.
Ugh same I have thick/wavy hair and it's super dry where I live. I try not to wash my hair more than twice a week.
Shaving is my favorite part of showering honestly.

To me it kind of feels like starting over new for the day. Like, if I've had a horrible day, I can shower, feel clean and different, and once I step out of the shower I feel like whatever bad things happened that day never actually happened. Plus, since I'm naked, I find new positive things about my body that I wouldn't have noticed while clothed. For example, lately my back and shoulders have gotten bonier, so it makes me feel happy.
Ugh! I wish I could do this but even having 1 cup of coffee makes the scale read up to .6 pounds higher! And I always shower after I have my coffee, otherwise I cannot function :o

WRITING.TITLE: Is anyone else obsessed with showering?
WRITING.TEXT:
I take 2 showers a day. I especially need one after I ride, but even if I didn't exercise in a given day, I'll still take that second shower. It makes me feel clean, pure and fresh - physically *and* mentally. Before/after I shower is also the only time I'm naked, so post-shower is a good opportunity to give myself a full body check where I examine which areas are getting smaller and which areas need the most loss.
On a side note, has anyone experienced that their leg hair grows back *really* fucking quickly when they're restricting/fasting? Seriously, I'll shave my legs then within 36 hours there's enough hair to need to shave again.
You're totally right. I typically like dessert wines so I may just go with something drier if I *really* want my wine kick.
If you're not a vegetarian or vegan, I'm about to cook a relatively low cal keto dinner!

This breaks rule #1 but since you have a history of posting in this sub...idk.
I mean if you don't have an eating disorder, please do not go about trying to develop one. For future reference, no one on this sub is going to tell you *how* to lose weight via ED behaviors. If you want general weight loss tips, head over to /r/loseit.
Yo, it sounds like you're really ready for recovery and I am honestly so damn proud of you 3 3 3
Oh! A wine spritzer. That's a really good idea!

Omg! I was going to post something like this, too! I'm on Day 2 and I absolutely love it. It's almost 3pm now, I had an omelet cooked in coconut oil at 10am and I'm still not hungry! I have a lot of energy and I'm in a great mood! Plus, keto doesn't bloat me at all so my stomach is still concave even after eating a meal. However, I do feel *slightly* nauseated since I'm not used to eating so much fat.
I prefer Moscato and whites in general so that's good to know! In terms of...drunkness, how "drunk" did you get off however much wine you had?

WRITING.TITLE: Skinny Girl wines
WRITING.TEXT:
Have any of you tried these?
Since I am restricting and now doing keto, their 100 cal per 5 oz and only 5g of carbs is really appealing to me. I've tried Skinny Girl's ready-to-serve margaritas and it freaking tasted like Pine Sol so I'm a bit skeptical of their wines.

Thank you! Yeah the nausea is my biggest complaint right now. So far, I haven't experienced "keto flu", probably because I'm used to eating so low cal anyways. Eggs + butter/oil is a great way to test out keto, I highly suggest it!
